description:
Installed very easily via the Ubuntu app installer 'Discover'.
Took me a few minutes to figure out how to set my location accurately rather than to some nearby city.
It loads quickly and has features I commonly use such as current "solar system" layout, "Whats Interesting" and "What's up Tonight".
i CAN INSTALL IT ERROR FLY ON MY HEAD (DON'T ASK ME WHY I USE CAP)
It depends on a mispelled package, meaning that I cannot install it via terminal. I have emailed Jonathan Riddell and posted on the KDE forums as well to see if I can get this fixed.
Recommended for astrophotography, with Ekos it is very good
I live in a small city in Brazil, and I could not put the latitude and longitude of it. The closest possible was Sao Paulo. Useless.

I use kstars and ekos on a raspberry pi 3, running stallarmate os. It has incredible functionality that allows me to operate my camera, autoguider, and telescope mount from indoors, over my wifi network. Highly recommended for any budget astrophotographer!

This is for the Ekos sub program. Sees the cameras, gets their ID info, but will not take a photo. I downloaded direct from the Kstars web site, and guess what? No remove function. I will have to wipe my disk to get it removed, and re-install Ubuntu and my Aps.
summary: Unable to Operate on Odroid h2

description: I was able to enter my home location but there are a couple "bugs" to overcome. Under Settings - Geographic, you can enter your on location. In the "View/Edit" portion of the Choose city screen - Enter a new city name (I started by selecting a city close to me and added Home to the name, input the "province or state, country, the Lat-Log coordinates, elevation, and UT offset. Now here's the bug. There are three buttons above the Cancel and OK buttons (bottom right) that are grayed out. In the Windows version these are "+" "Disk Icon" and "-" going left to right. Click the "+" button on the left and your location should be added to the list of cities. This is in the K-Stars version I downloaded Oct 2020. The Windows version of K-Stars does not have this "bug". I am still working through the Windows verses Ubuntu versions but the Windows version appears to be more "de-bugged".

Feels like an abandoned project. Or at least they ended up outsourcing it to different companies who ended up fixing it up for their own purposes and charging money for it ('Stellarmate, AsiAir Pro) . Meanwhile the core version offered for free lacks any updates, lacks camera and mount drivers, not even the icons are fixed , which requires a breeze name theme installed before the program gets actually usable. z
What a shame.

Contrary to what Paulo says, you CAN enter latitude and longitude.
It's a bit confusing because the boxes are greyed out, but you can click on them and enter the figuresigures.
Then you can save that location, and it becomes default.
This is a great app for stargazing and astronomy on many levels.
Good for basic display, but also lots of functions and features, including telescope control.
Altho tbh I prefer Stellarium.
 - Terry

KStars offers just about everything I want as an amateur astronomy buff, and it's so powerful and expandable that I don't think I'll ever outgrow it.

You can use it to plan a nightly observing session, see high-resolution previews of astronomical objects, get recommendations for what to look at tonight, and control astrophotography rigs. The preview imagery available for download is stunning. I'm only somewhat ashamed to admit that there have been nights when I was feeling tired and lazy and I browsed the cosmos using KStars rather than actually taking out my telescope.
Verwende die Software seit ich mit Linux arbeite, wird mit jeder Version besser
No solo es un mapa celeste de primera calidad, sino que también abre archivos FITS con una buena elección inicial de contrastes
the first choice of part-time astronamy lovers
